page.title: 15RESTENNETH-HUNTER LIBRARY
page.content: The large stone building adjacent to the Priory was built by a family trust in 1970 mainly for research and{ {information systems.}It houses the Scottish history{Library}provided by the Graham Hunter Foundation and a small number of museum exhibits, including armour and swords. Two members of the Hunter Family are residential custodians of Restenneth Library. The Hunter{Charitable Trust have hosted Historical Society meetings, Seminars, and{Conferences, and on average, some 500 visitors come to the Library annually. Funding had been made available to complete the "Dictionary of the Older Scottish Tongue" which will be a very valuable work for students doing Historical Research and a Scottish / American exchange student scholarship.
